skill.name: popup-cro
skill.description: When the user wants to create or optimize popups, modals, overlays, slide-ins, or banners for conversion purposes. Also use when the user mentions "exit intent," "popup conversions," "modal optimization," "lead capture popup," "email popup," "announcement banner," or "overlay." For forms outside of popups, see form-cro. For general page conversion optimization, see page-cro.
skill.summary: Create high-converting popups, modals, and banners with expert strategies for timing, design, and messaging.
skill.author: coreyhaines31

security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. This is a text-based conversion optimization skill containing only documentation about popup strategies. The scanner flagged generic text patterns as security issues (e.g., 'localStorage' references at line 230 for frequency capping, which is standard UX practice). No malicious code, cryptographic operations, or reconnaissance patterns exist in this skill.

content.value_statement: Users struggle with intrusive popups that annoy visitors and hurt conversions. This skill provides expert strategies for creating popups, modals, and banners that convert without damaging user experience.
actual_capabilities: Design popup strategies based on purpose (email capture, lead magnet, discount, exit intent)
Recommend optimal triggers (time-based, scroll-based, exit intent, behavior-based)
Create conversion-focused copy for headlines, subheadlines, CTAs, and decline options
Advise on frequency capping and user preference storage to respect visitor choices
Ensure GDPR compliance and accessibility standards in popup implementation
A/B test hypotheses for popup variations and optimization strategies
limitations: Does not generate actual code or HTML/CSS for popup implementation
Does not integrate with specific popup tools or platforms
Does not access real-time analytics or conversion data from your site
Does not provide legal compliance verification for specific jurisdictions

prompt_templates.title: Basic Email Popup
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an email capture popup for my [type of site]. My goal is to [primary conversion goal]. My target audience is [visitor description]. Please recommend the popup type, trigger timing, and provide sample headline, subheadline, and CTA button text.
prompt_templates.scenario: Creating a simple popup from scratch

prompt_templates.title: Exit Intent Strategy
prompt_templates.prompt: Design an exit intent popup strategy for my [e-commerce/SaaS/content] site. I want to capture [what] before visitors leave. Include the popup copy, trigger logic, and how this differs from my entry popup.
prompt_templates.scenario: Recovering abandoning visitors with exit intent

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Popup Funnel
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a multi-popup strategy for my site with [traffic description]. I want [number] popups that work together without annoying visitors. Include purpose, trigger, audience targeting, and conflict rules for each popup.

prompt_templates.prompt: Design an A/B test plan for my popup. I want to test [variable: headline/CTA/timing/design]. My current conversion rate is [X]%. Please provide test hypotheses with expected outcomes and recommended sample sizes.

output_examples.input: Create a discount popup for my online clothing store targeting first-time visitors with a 15% discount.
output_examples.output:
**Popup Type:** Exit Intent Modal

**Trigger:** Mouse movement toward browser controls or back button

**Copy:**
- Headline: "Wait! Get 15% Off Your First Order"
- Subhead: "Join 50,000+ fashion lovers who get exclusive deals weekly. No spam, ever."
- CTA: "Claim My 15% Off"
- Decline: "No thanks"

**Design Notes:**
- Center modal, 500px wide
- Product lifestyle image on left, offer on right
- Close button top-right, click-outside-to-close enabled
- Mobile: Full-width bottom slide-up

**Frequency:** Once per session, 30-day cookie on dismissal

output_examples.input: What are the best practices for popup timing on a SaaS blog?
output_examples.output:
**Recommended Popup Strategy for SaaS Blog:**

**Primary Popup:** Scroll-Triggered Newsletter Signup
- Trigger: 50% scroll depth (shows engaged reader)
- Timing: ~20-40 seconds on page
- Copy Focus: "Get more [topic] insights" not "Subscribe"

**Secondary Popup:** Exit Intent for Lead Magnet
- Trigger: Mouse exit intent
- Offer: Free [relevant resource/ebook]

**Avoid:**
- Time-based popups under 30 seconds
- Popups on checkout pages
- More than one popup per session

**Frequency Cap:** Once per 7 days maximum

best_practices: Match popup offer to visitor intent and page context rather than using generic messaging.
Always provide clear value upfront and respect visitor choices with easy dismissal options.
Test one variable at a time (headline, timing, design) to understand what drives conversions.
anti_patterns: Using manipulative tactics like pre-checked opt-ins or misleading decline button labels.
Showing popups immediately on page load or before users can engage with content.
Ignoring mobile experience with aggressive full-screen overlays that block navigation.

faq.question: What is the best trigger for my popup?
faq.answer: The best trigger depends on your goal. Click-triggered works best for lead magnets (user-initiated, high intent). Scroll-based suits content engagement. Exit intent captures abandoning visitors. Time-delays (30+ seconds) work for general awareness but risk annoying users.

faq.question: How often should I show popups to the same visitor?
faq.answer: Show at most once per session. Use cookies or localStorage to remember dismissals for 7-30 days. Respect when users say noâ€”they have already made a choice.

faq.question: Do popups hurt SEO?
faq.answer: Google penalizes intrusive interstitials that block content on mobile. Cookie notices, age verification, and reasonable banners are fine. Avoid full-screen popups that appear before content on mobile devices.

faq.question: What conversion rate should I expect?
faq.answer: Typical benchmarks: Email popups 2-5%, Exit intent 3-10%, Click-triggered 10%+ (self-selected audience). Your results depend on offer relevance, timing, and traffic quality.

faq.question: How do I make popups accessible?
faq.answer: Ensure keyboard navigation (Tab, Enter, Esc to close). Use focus trapping while modal is open. Add ARIA labels for screen readers. Maintain color contrast ratios. Never rely on color alone to convey information.

faq.question: Can I use the same popup on mobile and desktop?
faq.answer: Not recommended. Mobile users have different behaviors and screen constraints. Use bottom slide-ups or full-width banners on mobile instead of center modals. Exit intent cannot be detected on mobileâ€”use scroll depth or time-based triggers instead.
